channel.title: Port forward help :D <---- Please
channel.description:
hey i got a problem with portforwarding i can code etc... but i am a failure in hosting :S ive tried so many things but they al wont work for me :S so i gave up and ask u guys , i just gona show you how i did it like its normal.
1-so i opend my gateway in my internet browser i logged in ( d-link DIR-655 is my router)
2-i clicked advanced
3- i clicked port forwarding
4-i call it by name ( for example ) faggerscape
5- and by IP aderes i just typ my IP ( ye i am sure its good -,- ) CMD ---> ipconfig ----> ip ...
6-computer name i selected my pc ( M-PC)
7- i did nothing by application name i just left that .
8- and finaly i did port 43594 by TCP and UDP
9- i pressed safe settings and it was loading and when it was done loading it was gone the hole shit i just put in there... so i thought k maybe its good so and i wanted to try it
10- i set in my client files in the gui the IP to the ip i typed in the IP aderes in the portforward.
11- i tested it on like 4 PC's from friends , some sick ass who didnt put a password on his LAN XD and i all doenst work :S
SO HELP me pl0x :D i will kiss ur feets 1000 times

item.title: Port forward help :D <---- Please
item.dc:creator: @deathscapepkz deathscapepkz
item.description:
@deathscapepkz wrote:

you put your normal ip from typing “ipconfig” into cmd, put your ip where it says ip address: on the portforward website.then go into your server files and put what ever your server ip is from no-ip client what you made. (im not good at explaining)

Read full topic

try making a virtual server too

wth try making a virtual server too??
i just want to portforward :rolleyes:
[/quote] becuz i haz d-link too, and u have to make virtual server on router[/quote]

aah thanks i gona try ;D

item.title: Port forward help :D <---- Please
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

MediaFire

Port Forward.zip

MediaFire is a simple to use free service that lets you put all your photos, documents, music, and video in a single place so you can access them anywhere and share them everywhere.

this does it all for you, and has a port checker.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forward help :D <---- Please
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

hey i got a problem with portforwarding
i can code etc… but i am a failure in hosting :S
ive tried so many things but they al wont work for me :S
so i gave up and ask u guys , i just gona show you how i did it
like its normal.

1-so i opend my gateway in my internet browser i logged in
( d-link DIR-655 is my router)

2-i clicked advanced

3- i clicked port forwarding

4-i call it by name ( for example ) faggerscape

5- and by IP aderes i just typ my IP ( ye i am sure its good -,- ) CMD —> ipconfig ----> ip …

6-computer name i selected my pc ( M-PC)

7- i did nothing by application name i just left that .

8- and finaly i did port 43594 by TCP and UDP

9- i pressed safe settings and it was loading and when it was done loading it was gone the hole shit i just put in there… so i thought k maybe its good so and i wanted to try it

10- i set in my client files in the gui the IP to the ip i typed in the IP aderes in the portforward.

11- i tested it on like 4 PC’s from friends , some sick ass who didnt put a password on his LAN XD and i all doenst work :S

SO HELP me pl0x i will kiss ur feets 1000 times

Read full topic
